headline: Salsa Chicken Rice Casserole
description: Layers of rice, chicken, cheese, and a creamy salsa sauce are baked in an easy, flavorful casserole.

video.description: See how to make a top-rated, Mexican-inspired casserole.
video.name: Salsa Chicken Rice Casserole

name: Salsa Chicken Rice Casserole
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup

recipeInstructions.text: Place rice and water in a saucepan, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes.

Meanwhile, place chicken breast halves into a large saucepan, and fill the pan with water. Bring to a boil, and cook for 20 minutes, or until done. Remove chicken from water. When cool enough to handle, cut meat into bite-size pieces.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.

In a medium bowl, combine Monterey Jack and Cheddar cheeses. In a separate bowl, mix together cream of chicken soup, cream of mushroom soup, onion, and salsa. Layer 1/2 of the rice, 1/2 of the chicken, 1/2 of the soup and salsa mixture, and 1/2 of the cheese mixture in prepared dish. Repeat layers, ending with cheese.
Bake in preheated oven for about 40 minutes, or until bubbly.

review.reviewBody: I really liked this recipe! It wasn't too labor intensive and was pretty cheap to make, too! I needed one that I could freeze, and I will definitely make this one again. I did make a good bit of adjustments, though: - I actually didn't use the salsa at all (I don't really love jarred salsa and didn't feel like making my own). Instead, I topped with sour cream and hot sauce (I think next time I'll try a buffalo sauce instead). - shredded a whole rotisserie chicken instead of baking chicken breasts - sautéed the onion before baking, along with 4 cloves of garlic, two large jalapeño peppers (seeds included), and one medium yellow bell pepper. Will probably add another jalapeño pepper and a green bell pepper next time (veggie lover). - substituted Monterey Jack cheese for pepper jack, per another reviewer's suggestion - covered dish with aluminum foil before baking I usually get tired of eating the same thing more than 2 or 3 times in a week (partly why I wanted a freezer friendly meal), but I've already eaten half of it and am nowhere close to sick of it!
My husband loved this. I did add a 4oz can of diced green chiles and a can of corn according to other comments.

Oh my goodness! You have GOT to try this recipe - it made a wonderful dinner. Even my picky eaters loved it. This was really delicious. And easy! I did make one change: put the rice and water in the pan first, uncooked after preparing the chicken (because I wanted to use only one pan). I added 35 minutes to cooking time to make sure all the water was absorbed by the rice (timed to make sure rice was fully cooked). But otherwise, I followed the recipe faithfully - Added my own fresh salsa recipe on top when serving (onion, tomato, cilantro, seeded jalapeno, and a pinch of cumin), and added a side of steamed broccoli, and a good meal was had by all.
very delicous way to use a costco rotisserie chicken.
I made the changes suggested, using garlic, cumin, onion and roasted peppers and mix cheeses. I also added cilantro and fresh jalapeno. Delish!
My boys loved this recipe! I made a couple changes, Used brown rice, and used a rotisarie chicken. I also added a can of green chilies, fresh cilantro to the soup/salsa part!

I love this! We cooked some frozen corn and mixed it in after cooking. We have also added sour cream at serving time and still awesom. Also adding in fritos at serving to to add crunchies was again amazing!
Great easy recipe. I did add a corn/black bean/red pepper Mexican veggie mix I had in the freezer. Worked perfectly.

My husband roasted a chicken with no plans of what to do with it. I took the breasts off the chicken and cut it up. Added taco seasoning. He cooked the rice for me in the instapot and added the onions when he cooked the rice. We also added a can of drained whole corn. We mixed the rice, onions and corn with the soup mixture. Did a layer of rice mixture, lauer of chicken cheese then rice mixture topped off with more cheese. Super easy and tasty.

I have made this twice now, and froze half of it as there is a lot, and there are only two of us. Plus it’s nice to have an easy thaw and heat meal. The only change I made is, I cheated and used a rotisserie chicken, and since I like spicy, used the hot version of rotel. Thank you for a delicious recipe!

I've been using this recipe for about 5-6 years and since the first time I made it I did things a bit differently. Cook chicken breast in skillet. When cool, dice into 1" pieces. Cook 1 and 1/2 cups brown rice in a large pot. Mix cooked chicken and rice. Mix in about 6 oz shredded cheddar, about 4 oz shredded pepper jack, and 2 cans of cream of chicken soup and one can of mild Rotel tomatoes. Mix very well and place in greased/buttered baking dish. 350 oven about 30 minutes. When bubbly, top with another 2oz each of cheddar and pepper jack until all melty. Yum! Basically cooking what needs cooked and then just mixing it all together, No layering, easy and just as tasty!

We thought it was good but made with the following changes. Instead of white rice, we used Knorr's Spanish Rice. Also shredded the chicken and added some hot sauce. It was very good, will definitely make again..
Used medium salsa over mild by preference, but overall turned out excellent! Super easy to make and tastes amazing.
It was wonderful but I thought it was a lot of work but it's worth it. Served it with a really good salad

I made this with using 3 & 1/2 cups cooked minute rice and sautéed raw chicken cubes with onions. I seasoned the chicken with onion and garlic powder, salt and pepper, and Cumin and Chili Powder. I followed the rest of the recipe as written. Had I boiled the chicken and not seasoned it, I think this recipe would be very bland as others have stated. I will make it again and add a sautéed green pepper and some cooked bacon. I think it would be fabulous!
I added taco seasoning to the chicken and sauted with onion. Also added black beans. Loved it!
This is a great Mexican casserole!! Full of flavor! I serve it with warmed tortillas!

We made this pretty much as the recipe is written, we added a 1/2 of a green pepper because it was in the fridge. We also used our own salsa . We really liked it. Next time we will add more salsa and a whole green pepper
Very tasty, the onions remained on the crunchy side after baking, so I will sauté them first the next time I make this

My husband doesn't like Mexican food. He's suspicious of anything that might be spicy. He Loved this recipe! It's very cheezy. I think the level of spiciness depends on the salsa you use. I used mild. I also used 2 cups of rice that I had frozen. (Make a big batch in the Instant Pot and save it for later in the freezer.) I also used 2 cups of Costco precooked rotisserie chicken. These 2 steps saved a lot of time and effort. My husband had seconds each time I served it. That's what I consider a success.

I didn’t have any cream of mushroom soup, so I used 2 cans of cream of chicken. I seasoned the chicken with pepper, seasoned salt, and onion powder. Tasted great! I think cooking the chicken in taco seasoning does kick it up a notch.

4 stars with revisions.
Just reading the recipe and then the reviews, it was clear this recipe was far too bland and tasteless for my family, but it had potential. I used hot salsa, (may try spicy green instead of red next time), and at least a tablespoon of garlic and a teaspoon of cumin. I didn't have it, but next time I'll replace the mushroom soup with a 1/2 or full cup of Mexican crema. I chopped up pickled jalapenos and sprinkled them on top. It was very tasty, and worth making again. I also think that next time I'll sprinkle taco seasoning over the rice before putting the chicken in.

This is a great dish for kids if you use mild salsa and sauté the onions first so they aren’t so strong. You could add jalapeños with the chicken or taco seasoning. I serve with a dollop of sour cream.

Half cheese put on top. 
Add two packages ChiChis taco mix.

This recipe is delicious!!! Very satisfying and comforting. And so easy! I added a chicken bouillon cube to the water for the chicken and the rice. Also added a little guacamole seasoning and salsa seasoning to the sauce. Definitely will make this again!
Easy, quick, and yummy!
I sauteed the onions before baking the casserole and used mild salsa verde.
Great recipe, although if you’re using salsa that already has onions in it, a full onion isn’t necessary. Other than that it was cheesy goodness!!!!
This was so good! Even my son who doesn't like casseroles really liked it.
Not great. Won’t make again.
Family loved it & couldn't get enough. Added a can of black beans with chicken. Will make again.

Did not have cream of chicken soup so I used cream of potato instead, worked well. Great flavor.
Will make again
I thought this was okay. My hubby did not like it. Won't make it again.
I love it! Have made it many times and will keep doing so! My whole family loves it too
Absolutely delicious! The only thing I did differently with substitute half the onion with a couple of chopped green onions, for a little bit of color variation. It enhanced the flavor, too.

This is one of my staple recipes for dinner. Use a rotisserie chicken and a can of Rotel for the salsa to make it even easier. I always use brown rice, and I mix up everything but the cheese in the baking dish, then top with cheese. Sometimes I serve it with chips, but it doesn’t need it. It is creamy, cheesy, and a little spicy with the Rotel. So yummy!
Winner! Tastes like Arroz con Pollo you get from a restaurant. No changes made.
I've been making this for years and my family loves it. The only change I make is to add medium or hot salsa instead of mild.
It turned out pretty good! We reduced the cheese since we didn't have much and used a big can of cream of mushroom soup. I think next time I will add chili beans.
It was good! I boiled the chicken and it was chewy. Onions were still a little raw. I might try cooking the chicken and onions in a fry pan before baking. But I loved the flavor!!

This is a time of stretching meals while we shelter in place so I had to make a few changes. 
I only used 3 small chicken breast and 1 cup of salsa. I also didn't want to use the last of the fresh onion I had so I mixed onion powder in with the rice. I also had one of those giant bags of crispy onions (the ones you buy the day before Thanksgiving at a large warehouse store) and added about 1/2 cup of them to the top . I covered/baked for 30 minutes then uncovered to add crispy onion and baked 15 more minutes. Keeper!
This was absolutely delicious. I added 3 poblano peppers and a jalepeno pepper for a added bite.

Kids liked it which is what matters most. I tried seasoning the chicken slightly with taco seasoning, but I think what made the difference is the soup. I used one can of the cream of chicken, but substituted the other can if soup with cream of jalapeño soup that I had.

I’ve been on a Sunday casserole kick lately in order to give us lunch through the week, and this one makes the cut. I made a couple of modifications...I used a rotisserie chicken (shredded), and I used medium salsa instead of mild. I mixed the soup mixture in with the chicken before spreading. I also made this into more of a “lasagna” by layering flour tortillas in as well. I topped mine with sour cream & my husband topped his with guacamole, and we both had a few pickled jalapeños and a side of blue corn chips. Our son ate it as-is with a side of chips. It seemed to be lacking just a little bit of freshness, but I’m not sure what else I would change to bring that to the dish...maybe top with lettuce & tomato. All in all, I think this one will be added to our Sunday casserole rotation.
I added about a cup of ranch, 2 cans of corn, and cooked the chicken with diced green pepper, onion, a clove of garlic, and taco seasoning. I also added about 3/4 cup chicken stock. Soooo good!!

It was very delicious and the texture was just right, I chopped up 1/4th cup of celery and for the topping crust I crushed saltine crackers and melted butter as well as taco shredded cheese and put the crust on about 15 minutes before it was done ! It was just perfect!
So much flavor

It was very good. My son loves it and has had it twice this week already!

It's a keeper
Wow...something so basic with random stuff in my kitchen tasted so delicious!
Great recipe. I cheated and chopped a store-bought rotisserie chicken, heated the rest of ingredients on stove and then baked. Thanks for sharing.

Excellent weeknight casserole. I made extra and froze a container, which I’ll defrost and use another time. I did add sautéed onions and peppers in herbed butter but even without this addition, a great meal. Thank you for sharing.
Super creamy and cheesy. I omitted the chicken and served as a side dish with green enchiladas. The whole family loved it.

Great recipe! I had to change it up a bit though. I didnt have chicken thawed so I chopped up onion and sauteed with ground beef and seasoned with taco seasoning and garlic powder. I used Zatarrains yellow rice in place of white rice. It turned out great and even pleased my picky eater. I paired with chips and queso, crowd pleaser!!

I couldn’t bring myself to boil the chicken breasts. In the video it just looked so soggy. I cut them up and sautéed them with a green pepper and onion with chicken taco seasoning and some cilantro. I kid you not my honey ate half the pan by himself and wants it again soon. Definite keeper.
Followed the recipe & am making it again this weekend!

When I tried to spread the rice in the pan, there wasn't nearly enough! So I added a can of black beans and a can of corn. To the soup and salsa mixture, I added a tsp cumin. Otherwise, I made it as called for and we all loved it!! Next time, tho, I will add a can of green chiles, and not bother layering, b/c really, we couldn't tell.

We had leftover rice and chicken, so not only was making this a no brainer, it was a breeze as well! Fast and easy, and OH SO GOOD! His Majesty actually made this and was so proud of himself. We like a little spice, so we are thinking about increasing the salsa next time, and perhaps using a medium or spicy salsa instead, or adding a bit of hot paprika, ancho or chipotle chili spice to kick it up a bit. We're definitely making this again! For any make ahead cooks out there - we will be experimenting with making this then vacuum packing the container and freezing. Our plan is to take it camping then throwing the frozen casserole into a pot of water and bringing it up to a boil. Easy heat and eat. We'll report once we've tried it. Thanks Gweneth for a great recipe that my hubby wants to make himself. It's a real keeper of a recipe.
I added a cup more rice. Would be good with black beans added to it...

I gave this recipe 5 stars for it's versatility. My family likes heat with their Mexican food and I don't like anything spicy. As written, I thought the recipe looked to bland for us. Here are the changes I made. I used 2 packs of Knorr Spanish Rice. I used 2 cans of Kirkland brand chicken. I sauteed the chicken in olive oil along with onions and green peppers. I combined cream of chicken soup and the salsa and added that to the chicken mixture. Tossed in a can of drained black beans and fire roasted corn. Topped with crushed Doritos and Mexican style cheese. Covered with foil and baked 40 minutes. I omitted the sour cream because I'm lactose intolerant. Hubby and kids added it to theirs. This recipe is a keeper. Thanks for sharing.
I browned the chicken and sautéed the onion(added garlic as well). It makes the casserole have a deeper flavor.
SO GOOD! The only thing I did differently was saute the chopped onion in butter to soften.
Very good!!
I left out the cream of mushroom soup because I thought it would be too soupy but I did have to add a little extra salsa. My family loved this, will definitely make again.

Really good! I didn't layer anything. I added a can of black beans and just mixed everything together, except for the cheese. I added half the cheese to the mix and put the other half on top. I baked it in a dutch oven with the lid off. Easy and delicious. It's a keeper.

I was able to use my leftover salsa in this recipe. I used brown rice, pepper jack cheese and Mexican cheese as I did not want to go to the store. I would do the same cheeses again, it was very tasty.
We didn't add the onion- but this was so good! It was fairly easy to make and made a huge pan, so we will have lots of leftovers. My husband loved it too!
I added some habanero pieces to it. Absolutely fabulous
I love how versatile this recipe is. I made it, LOVED it, and made it again with a few differences just based on what I had in my pantry. This recipe is a WINNER. Easy and delicious.
Very good. Will make this again, and again!

I love making this dish!! the second time I made it- I cut the chicken into cubes before boiling it. added a can of corn and black beans into the soup/sala mixture. after chicken was cooked I put some taco seasoning on the chicken. made 2 1/2 cups instant rice and 1 8oz bag of cheese divided in half for the 2 layers!
so yummy. did not precook the rice. I mixed the raw rice and water for it into the soups mix for the layering and covered with foil for half the cooking.

This is definitely a go to at my house. I omitted the onion because my family doesn’t care for it plus the salsa has some in it already. Also mixed everything together vs layering it and it came out great!
We have made this many time. Increased the rice to 2 cups uncooked. Otherwise, we have followed the recipe as is.
Overrated
The only change was i used cream of broccoli because I had no cream of chicken and had more rice than needed so just put it all in

I made this for dinner yesterday and my family loved it! I did some things different. I cooked the chicken in the crockpot on high for 3 1/2 hours. I put a can of chicken broth and a pack of taco season. The chicken came out really tender and not dry. I pre made mexican rice. I also used a can of rotel instead of salsa. Once everything was done I put it all in a casserole dish and cooked in the oven for 30 minutes.
I substituted chives for onion because of my allergy to onion & added jalapeno cheddar for extra flavour. It was amazing & very easy for a beginner such as myself :)

Next time, I will double the amount of rice. When it came out of the oven I thought it would be really soupy but once it set up it was very good. Are used hot or salsa and also added some garlic salsa into the recipe. It is not bland whatsoever with the hotter salsa and garlic salsa. I will be making this again!
I followed the recipe. The only difference is that I use the rice cooker instead of a saucepan to cook the rice. It's delicious. And the whole family love it!
Used. Left over turkey

I have to thank Crystal S for her review and tweaks, that, more than anything made me want to try this recipe. My husband insists I make this again! Also bigger thanks to Gweneth, the original submitter for such a great recipe that others loved it and added to it!
Bland, bland, bland. Onions were raw. Tasted better with hot sauce on it. Probably won’t make again.
I love it. I will make it again for sure.

Followed recipe exactly. It was delicious. I used thin cut chicken breasts and they were a little over cooked at 20 minutes. I would use the thick cut chicken breasts next time, as I would like more chicken in it. I feel like ground beef would be really yummy in place of the chicken too. Might experiment with that next time!
So easy, only once change. Used boneless, skinless thighs and a few spices to kick up a notch as other mentioned they though it a bit bland.
Yummm!!

This casserole was incredibly delicious and my whole family loved it! Changes that I made was adding beans and corn as well as cooking the chicken in the pan beforehand with spices as suggested by other reviews. Overall was amazing!

This a great basic recipe to tweak to your liking. I did as others suggested and cut up the chicken and browned it with the onion and added a packet of chicken taco seasoning. For the soups I used fiesta nacho and cream of sweet corn and a can of rotel instead of salsa. I also added a can of corn. I will say it is a lot of rice, so I will scale that back next time. I will definitely be making this again!

Add: medium salsa, garlic, onions , poblanos, black beans!

Use left over chicken or rotisserie chicken=FASTER!
This was a nice change. We did enjoy it. I only had pepper jack cheese and it tasted real good.
Dish was really good!!
This is a very tasty dish that is inexpensive and filling.
No changes. Definitely will make again!

I cooked the chicken in olive oil with the onion, 1 tsp of minced garlic, and 1 tsp of cumin. I used 1 cup pepper jack cheese, 1/2 cheddar, 2 and 1/2 fiesta blend. I used a black bean and corn salsa mmh. I also used 2 cream of mushroom instead of chicken. Over all this was good. I also saw no need in layering all this separately. Once the chicken was done I added the other ingredients followed by the rice. I did layer with Cheese in the middle. My husband and son liked it which is saying a lot. I still thought it was slightly bland. I topped it off with a little salsa and sour cream which did the trick. Next time I make it I will tweak it a little more and either do more salsa or take out 1 can of soup. I’m thinking take a can of soup out. Over all it is a good recipe!

I made exactly as stated. I didn't think it was that great. It was bland tasting to me. I think with more spicy salsa and maybe more seasonings & a bit less cheese it might be better. I most likely will not be making this again.
Everyone loved this dish. Second helpings for everyone! No leftovers.
Definitely will make again!
Delicious and easy to make. Also relatively cheap to make
Very Good. I will make more rice the next time. I wanted a solid base of rice and with that there was very little to add to 2nd layer.
